value.title: Power BI REST API no-code options
value.excerpt: Adam shows how you can use the Power BI REST API without writing any code. Then takes it to the next level with PowerShell.  Power BI REST API Reference - https://docs.microsoft.com/rest/api/power-bi/ Power BI PowerShell reference - https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/power-bi/overview?view=powerbi-ps

value.title: Power BI Tutorial | From Flat File To Data Model
value.excerpt: In this Power BI Tutorial, Patrick looks at how to load data from a flat file to the data model. This could be a text, csv or excel file with a lot of columns. Don't just pull it into Power BI. Take time to structure your data in your data model. From flat file to data model is basic concept, but is
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/vjBprojOCzU" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Tools to take Power BI to the NEXT LEVEL
value.excerpt: We've mentioned them multiple times but now to bring them all together. These are the TOOLS you need to take Power BI to the NEXT LEVEL! Tools we use every day!  Performance Analyzer: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/create-reports/desktop-performance-analyzer  External tools in Power BI Desktop https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/transform-model/desktop-external-tools

value.title: Where to create your columns in Power BI | Data Modeling Best Practices
value.excerpt: Patrick continues the journey of data modeling best practices with looking at where to create your columns within Power BI. In the data source, in Power Query or using a DAX calculated column?  High Memory Usage and Calculated Columns (@tlachev) https://prologika.com/high-memory-usage-and-calculated-columns/

value.title: Working with time in Power BI Desktop

value.title: Combine Multiple or All Sheets from an Excel File into a Power BI solution Using Power Query Dynamic
value.excerpt: Combining multiple files from one folder is already supported built-in through the graphical interface of Power Query when use you Get Data from Folder. However, if you have one Excel file, with multiple sheets with the same structure but different data, you cannot use that option. There is a very little

value.title: Create a Table in Power BI using Enter Data and How to Edit it
value.excerpt: Sometimes you just need a new table with a few rows or columns to be added to your data model. One option to create that table is to use the Enter Data option in Power BI Desktop. In this article, I‚Äôll explain how you can use it, and also; more important: How to edit the data of that table after creating

value.title: Generate Year Month Day Combinations in Power BI Report using Power Query Date ToText Function
value.excerpt: A common requirement when reporting data with a Date axis is to be able to see the year and the month in a short form beside each other. Formats such as 2021 Jan, or Jan 2021, or even Jan 21, or 2021-01 are very popular. In Power BI, ideally, you should have a Date dimension with columns for this. However,
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/EtANwBVPIXQ" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Row Filtering in Power BI and Power Query   Remove Blank Rows Vs Remove Empty
value.excerpt: When you have blank values in your data table, you can use Power Query transformations to remove the row with blank values. There are two transformations that are used very often for this purpose: Remove Empty and Remove blank rows. These two transformations are not exactly the same. In this article,

value.title: Search Bar in Power BI Slicer

value.title: Creating real time dashboards in Power BI with push datasets
value.excerpt: Though you can build real-time reports with DirectQuery, push datasets offer a more scalable, economical, and effective solution especially when combined with an Import model already in place. This video introduces the architecture of push datasets. Article and download: https://www.sqlbi.com/?p=729917&aff=yt

value.title: Using ALLEXCEPT vs ALL VALUES
value.excerpt: ALLEXCEPT is a handy DAX function to retrieve all the columns of a table except for some. When used as a CALCULATE modifier, its behavior is less intuitive and might result in inaccurate measures. In this video, we elaborate on the most common mistake when using ALLEXCEPT in CALCULATE. Article and download:

value.title: Write DAX formulas for Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to write DAX formulas to create calculated tables, calculated columns, and measures, which are different types of model calculations. Additionally, you'll learn how to write and format DAX formulas, which consist of expressions that use functions, operators, references to model objects, constants, and variables.

value.title: Advanced Concatenate/ Merge columns with Power Query
value.excerpt: Concatenating columns in Power Query is not hard to do, but depending on the technique you use, you might get unexpected or wrong results.  There is a bullet proof way to do it and I will explain it here.  00:00 Intro & Problem description 01:19 How power query concatenates columns with Table.CombineColumns
